reviews.review: grape game fun scary, cat and mouse chase and takes alot of skill 10/10

With a friend, not taking the game seriously, and just trying to have fun, this game is great, it's interesting to learn the nuances of killers and survivors, how to counter or combat particular play styles. On super rare occasions you can even find a genuinely nice killer or survivors who help you get your tasks done or generally farm bloodpoints with you, which is handy because god damn do you need a lot of bloodpoints to get any of the decent stuff in the game. 
One of the better things in this game I'll admit is the questing capabilities, I've not long started playing again, so I have a Lot of quests, missions and objectives to complete, which gives me more of a reason to play, though some of the objectives are tedious, and having some needing specific characters...unless you're willing to put more Cash into the game, pretty much locks you out of certain objectives...but that nicely segues into;

My major issue with the game is the price...Having put almost 20 hours into the game at the time of this review I've gained just over 2k Iridescent shards, needing 9k to unlock 1 survivor or killer...yeah that's a lot of grinding, I like a fun grind and this is usually decently fun, but god damn...Not to mention if you want any of the licensed killers or survivors you need to put more money into the game, cos you know... [i]Micro-Transactions[/i] 

Personally I'd say make the games OC's bloodpoints buyable, Licensed characters Iridescent buyable, except perhaps the latest characters, sure have them on more of a premium for a while while you get your licensing money back, but Ya'll have got to be Raking it in at the cost of some of these...

O jogo é maravilhoso, porém, precisa ter muita paciência pra jogar, as atualizações demoram ABSURDOS pra baixar e instalar mesmo no SSD, o jogo verifica todos os arquivos umas três vezes, tirando isso que normalmente tenho que abandonar o pc sozinho por algumas horas pra ele instalar a atualização que é semanal praticamente, é um ótimo jogo

With skill based matchmaking being added I don't think I can recommend this game anymore. I understand the update wasn't meant for someone like me who is probably slightly higher in the mmr system. The problem is at higher levels of play you have to play more optimally and in my opinion playing Dead By Daylight as optimally as possible is unfun for both sides. 

I often found myself intentionally trying to lose to lower my mmr just for a few games that would be fun. Aside from just issues of fun I found my queue times to become unacceptable. On one of my mains my queues took 15-30 minutes on average after spending about a day of letting myself lose my queue times averaged 5 minutes. Not only did I experience long queue times and had less fun than I used to I've experienced a significant increase in hackers. From 1 or 2 in a few months to over 6 in 3 days.

You should know not everyone has had this kind of experience with the new system but as someone who has played since launch this is what killed the game for me. If you do try it I hope you enjoy it as I did and maybe I'll be around for major updates or maybe the mmr system will be refined enough for me to enjoy the game again.

This game is addictive and a lot of fun to play by yourself or with a group. It's a little repetitive, but they somehow found a way to make that a good thing. The developers treat each character and killer with respect, and the attention to detail is amazing. Anyone who is a fan of the horror genre, or just the old school movies will have a lot of fun playing as their favorite, either as killer or survivor. It's inexpensive and you don't need the DLC content to play (The killers are very well balanced and the game difficulty depends entirely on the competency of the player). The balance is on point and if you do decide to spend money, you won't feel cheated. Hellraiser just released and the DLC killer is just a perfect representation of Pinhead. My favorite maps are Springvale Elementary and the Gideon Meat Plant, both have loads of detail that show just how much they care about the series they pulled from. I'm going to find a way to throw some more money at the game right now actually. A+ video game, play it in the dark for the atmosphere or group with your friends and make it silly, it all works.

Игра подойдёт не каждому это факт, Сразу оговорюсь я описываю общую составляющую при игре за киллера тк они отличаются друг от друга, а выжившие ничем кроме моделек и навыков. В ней есть как плюсы так и минусы как и у других игр, вначале о первом
1. Необычная, затягивающая атмосфера, большое разнообразие персонажей за которых интересно играть(в основном убийцы), гемплей за каждого убийцу отличается.
2. Довольно приятная графика, не самая плохая оптимизация.
3. В неё просто здорово играть.
Переходим к минусам:
1. Советую тем кто не знаком с игрой подготовиться, ведь далеко не факт, что тебе кинет соперников твоего уровня. Тебе на убийце может попасться задрот на 3к часов и не имеет значения то что ты только игру купил.(при игре за выживших может попасться кибер спорт убийца)
2. Игра однообразна, но не в плане персонажей нет, а в том, что нам до сих пор не выпустили новый режим, новые приоритеты для выживших(что то кроме починки генераторов), каких то особых игровых механик. Только DLC и скины
3. Не удивляйтесь если вашего любимого персонажа знатно нерфанут из за новоиспечённого это обычное дело. Разработчики каждый раз исправляя одни баги делают новые, но это так уже придирки

I give this game a 6.5 / 10 because, this game has a lot of things i don't like : 
a) The developers' approach to game errors (they often cannot admit that the error is on their side).
b) They often make changes that break the balance of the game or make toxic tactics like tunnel, camp and gen rush busty. 
c) Every update from around 2018 breaks another thing that worked well before. 
Unfortunately, or maybe even fortunately, this is one of the best games of this type that are not dead (I refer to Gold Express), because the balance is pretty good and game can be addictive, so otherwise I wouldn't have had so many hours in this game
Я нормальный, просто поиграл немного.

Didn't enjoy/like it at first but I realized I was playing the game in the wrong way, I thought it was only about finishing the  generators and that's all  Hallalooya congratulations you've finished  the game, but yeah I was wrong, once I played the game for some time and had a lot of experience from the games I played, I see it's not only about finishing the generators, you have to finish generators, save your friends from chases/hooks and the most dangerous and epic moment 
" facing the killer "  which is more like a 1v1 arena where both minds are trying to mistake the other and see who will win. I enjoy it a lot now and I like the cool people who just take it easy and enjoy it as survivors as well.
And as a killer, you don't have to camp or focus on someone and that's all, you're ruining the enjoyment of the game. if you just play the game to do these things congratulations you're doing the same mistake I did but it is you as a killer.
and you're not only ruining the enjoyment for the others, but you're also ruining the enjoyment for yourself too
Overall I highly recommend it and I enjoy it 👍💖.
Stay safe💖.

Do you like the idea of unpacking and repacking 40GB of data every time the game receives a patch, regardless of its size?

Do you like the idea of thrashing your HDD repeatedly or putting tons of unnecessary I/O on your pricey SSD?

Do you like to sit around and wait for inefficient processes to finish just so you can launch your game and play for a little bit?

Look no further than DBD.  The game itself is absolutely fine, but instead of figuring out a better way to manage data, let's just keep adding bloat.

Dead by Daylight, un juego de "el gato y el ratón" en el que podemos encarnar el rol de superviviente (en el que debemos hacer equipo con otros 3, reparar 5 generadores y escapar por unas puertas de salida) o el de asesino (en el que debemos cazar a los 4 supervivientes y evitar que escapen).

Es un juego inteligente, pensado para pasarlo bien con amigos y capaz de ofrecernos momentos adrenalínicos como divertidos. 

Recomendable!!

Toxic community, fundamentally broken game design/mechanics (killers can camp or hold games hostage), long queue times, matchmaking is a joke (almost impossible to get matches where everyone is around the same rank), free to play systems in a game that actually costs money, in-game currency and XP (bloodpoints) accrue at a ridiculously slow rate (again, something you'd expect from a free to play game), SO MANY BUGS (maps are routinely disabled because devs can't fix anything so they outright disable them), penalties for leaving matches that are being held hostage by toxic players, poor optimization and virtually no graphics / frame rate options (30 or 60 only), more issues I don't even feel deserve my time to go into right now.

If you ignore the above issues, the game is pretty fun assuming you run into a bug-free game (rare) with survivors and killers both playing the game as intended (also incredibly rare... since there are no consequences, players on both sides are encouraged to be as toxic as possible and take advantage of flaws in the fundamental game design).

It's almost worth it if you buy the game on sale and are content never buying any DLC or cosmetics are they are grossly overpriced both in terms of real world money and in-game currency. Outside of a few meta perks, there is very little reason to actually buy any survivors as they can all learn any perk (takes a lot of grinding). Killers can also learn any perks but their innate ability is locked to each respective killer, so it does make more sense to buy a particular killer (tho you'll only ever run into 3-4 meta picks because devs don't know how to balance).
